laboratory_examinations.findings: A mass involving the lateral orbital musculature, with no evidence of bony erosion or invasion.
Well-defined mass posterior and lateral to the globe, 2.2 x 1.5 cm; it displaced the optic nerve medially and involved the lateral and superior rectus and superior oblique muscles.

laboratory_examinations.date: One week after initiation of chemotherapy
laboratory_examinations.findings: Enlarged tumor mass with areas of hypodensity consistent with the presence of necrosis.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Increase in size of the mass thought to be due to edema from treatment-induced necrosis.

laboratory_examinations.findings: Increased uptake of tracer in the lateral aspect of the right bony orbit but no evidence of distant disease.
Only a very small residual soft-tissue mass enhanced with contrast material; it has not changed in size.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: The residual mass has not changed in size.
